intro: Fleischmannia laxa, commonly known as the slender fleischmannia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its cylindrical, ribbed stems that can grow up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, typically in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are reduced to spines, and it is adapted to arid environments with minimal water requirements. Fleischmannia laxa is often found in rocky soils and is considered a rare species due to its limited distribution.
